page.title: 12The Male Voice Choir.
page.content: {Cor Meibion Creunant}was formed in 1971 at the Crynant Rugby Club and was at that time known as 'Creunant R.F.C. Male Voice Choir'. The Choir has competed in many eisteddfodau and given numerous charity concerts all over Wales. They have twice toured Workington in aid of charity and have taken part in the 'Welsh 1000 Voices' at the Royal Albert Hall in London on four occasions. During the{Miners' Strike}of 1984-85 the Choir played a major role in the raising of funds for the 'Dulais Valley Miners Support Group'. It was during this period that the local choirs combined to form what became known as the{'South Wales {Striking Miners Choir'. } Currently the Choir is preparing for its participation in the '1000 Voices' Festival at the Albert Hall.
